title: What was Korean music like before K-pop? - Quora

response.answer_text: Older Korean music, aside from traditional ones, begin with more semi-classical styles of 가곡, and trot, which is very similar to enka from Japan, along with some directly influenced from West such as disco, pop-funk and etc. Folk, pop ballad, rock, and synth pop-ish music were popular also, producers in the past used to follow international trends from Europe and US so in a way, the market was more diverse. Folk music, especially, was often used in civil movements and such, earning huge recognitions. Even till the debut of Taiji boys and during its career, market was more diverse than now.

Before KPop (ie before Tao Saeji & the Boys hit it huge in 1993) popular Korean music was Trot. Which is still popular, of course. Also ballads, which have never stopped being popular. There were rock bands in the 70s & 80s in Korea, and of course Korean kids listened to Western pop music.
